contents.p: This demo uses the d3 library to visualize data points over a responsive svg layer. Click spots to see their data, pan and zoom with the mouse, and double click to add a new spot. The application also scales when adjusting screen size.

The existing REPL for this library suffered from an inflexible layout, making it usable only on large screens. This project increased screen real estate and used Bootstrap to enable responsive layout adjustments at smaller screen sizes.

In addition to a responsive design, this practical application exemplifies MVVM and PubSub architecture. The Note model provides a Data Access Layer to localStorage and the View Models contain the logic to perform DOM updates.
Try the demo⇗
Tags: MVVM, PubSub, Bootstrap, Responsive Design, UX Design, localStorage
